CatDescriptText: Walter Person, treasury agent, Beltzhoover and Juan Bais Ayala, railroad worker, North Side, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 3, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Relative to the race riot in Montgomery, Ala., do you think the Federal Government should wait until a state asks for law enforcement help, or should the power of the United States be used immediately to protect a citizen's life when it is endangered?" Walter Person's answer reads: "The power of the United States should be used immediately, at all times, to protect all the rights of all the citizens." Juan Bais Ayala's answer reads: "I think the Government should act right away to protect the people.  If we keep respecting states' rights, nothing will be done.  Every state should obey the Federal Government.  Otherwise things would get worse..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of man wearing suit jacket and moustache, standing in front of building and back facing woman; Portrait of man wearing moustache, cap, and button down collared shirt with contrasting band on collar and pocket, standing in front of woman and building
